intro: Papualthia rudlophi, commonly known as the Hawaiian moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, red berries that contain the seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
